title: Docs - Google Cloud deployment archetypes: What's next
abstract:
# Docs - Google Cloud deployment archetypes: What's next
Last reviewed 2023-11-03 UTC
This section of the [Google Cloud deployment archetypes](/architecture/deployment-archetypes) guide lists resources that you can use to learn more about cloud deployment archetypes and best practices for building architectures for your cloud workloads.
- [Deployment Archetypes for Cloud Applications](https://dl.acm.org/doi/10.1145/3498336) : Research paper that this guide is based on.
- [Google Cloud Architecture Framework](/architecture/framework) : Recommendations to help you design and operate a cloud topology that's secure, efficient, resilient, high-performing, and cost-effective.
- [Hybrid and multicloud architecture patterns](/architecture/hybrid-and-multi-cloud-architecture-patterns) : Common architectural patterns for the hybrid and multicloud deployment archetypes.
- [Patterns for connecting other cloud service providers with Google Cloud](/architecture/patterns-for-connecting-other-csps-with-gcp) : Options for network connections between Google Cloud and other cloud platforms.
- [Global load-balancing architectures using DNS routing policies](/architecture/global-load-balancing-architectures-for-dns-routing-policies#use-cases-for-geolocation-dns-routing-policies) : Use cases for geolocation DNS routing policies.
- [Design reliable infrastructure for your workloads in Google Cloud](/architecture/infra-reliability-guide/design) : Design guidance to help to protect your applications against failures at the resource, zone, and region level.
- [Enterprise foundations blueprint](/architecture/security-foundations) : An opinionated enterprise foundations blueprint for a landing zone, with step-by-step guidance to configure and deploy your Google Cloud estate
